eventName: Come Catastrophes or Wakes of Vultures
storyInfo: While Liskarm and Franka are in talks with the bank, Jessica realizes that Blacksteel's arrival would deal a heavy blow to the locals who already are on the verge of bankruptcy. So she decides to aid the debt-stricken Leone.

attributes.content: You're gonna take out a loan from the bank? Have you lost your mind?
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: What's your plan then, wise guy? How do you reckon we get to Trimounts in just a few days? This clinical trial is Tibby's last chance!
attributes.name: Irritable Woman

attributes.content: I'll think of some other way...
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: What other way? No way we're getting that kinda money without a loan!
attributes.name: Irritable Woman

attributes.content: ...R-Right! Didn't we get health insurance for Tibby before? That should cover serious illness!
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: What the hell do you think I was doing all day yesterday? I went to the bank to cash out on the insurance, but Tibby's illness wasn't covered at all!
attributes.name: Irritable Woman

attributes.content: I'm begging you, please, let's not jump straight to taking out a loan, okay?
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: Just think about your sister. She only took a small loan, but it ruined her life. Remember how much she suffered until finally...
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: Her entire family died on their way to the frontier.
attributes.name: Irritable Woman

attributes.content: So calm down and think this through. There's gotta be another way.
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: Why do I see this stuff every damn time I come to the bank?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: All the more reason for us to be here. And especially for us to attend this so-called 'welcoming party,' Franka.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: If we don't witness these things with our own eyes... we'll forever remain left in the dark.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Is Fort Barron going to tow Davistown back onto its original route all by itself?
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: This request was made directly by the regional government. The outcome will affect Blacksteel's image and credibility. We'll give this mission our all.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Good to hear. We appreciate it.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: All part of the job.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Would the two of you like beer or champagne? We're out in the sticks, so you may find our selection rather unsatisfactory. All I ask is that you bear with us.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: ...Unsatisfactory? You're too humble.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Take a look, Captain. This beer has no label on the bottle, but it's just as good as any niche brand from a craft brewery. The champagne's also high-end... I must say, excellent taste.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: It's important to keep some luxury items on hand when you're stationed in a difficult area. We do have to keep up morale, after all.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: Is cranking up the thermostat so high that people want to crack open an ice-cold beer also part of keeping up morale?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: ...Well, yes, as you've noted we do have a separate backup energy supply, which includes heating and electricity.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: Funny how no one else seems to have this backup system.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: That would be due to the prescience of our first president during the early planning and development phases. An important safety consideration.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: The services provided by a financial institution are somewhat unique. Large amounts of money flow in and out, and be it systems or resources, it's always better to be more self-reliant.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: Presumably, Blacksteel built their safe house here in Davistown out of the very same concerns. Isn't that right, Miss Franka?
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: Oh... I'm fine with just a glass of water. I'll leave the beer for your employees. To keep up morale.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: We've sent people back to Blacksteel HQ to report the repair status of Davistown's power plant.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: As the plant has not been restored to a state where it can support navigation, HQ will naturally have to formulate a new solution.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: We are very appreciative of your company's contributions to our town.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: However, until a solution is in place, we do have one humble request.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: ...What sort of request?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: We were hoping you could help maintain law and order here.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: I'm sure you've already encountered bandits on the town's outskirts. They've caused us a substantial amount of damage. Even more troubling is the fact that...
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: ...a number of people living here are, to put it nicely, bandits themselves. To put it less nicely, they're the bandits' reserve army.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: We would be very grateful if you could clear them out of Davistown. Here's a list of namesâ€”
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: Over the past few days, we've sent personnel to conduct security operations around the plate's perimeter. Based on their reports, I have little reason to believe that so many dangerous elements are operating here.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: There are people here with no money, yet are unwilling to put in the work to pay back their debts. How can you guarantee they won't resort to more... desperate measures down the line?
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: ...If you insist. We'll look into it.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: You'll 'look into it'? Why must you verify it yourselves? You can't take us at our word?
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: If our trust is so fragile that it's broken just by double-checking a list, then it wasn't worth much to begin with.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: ...Do as you please, then.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: But if you really want to check things, be sure to be thorough.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: How'd it go? Any developments on your end?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Mm. The target's already entered visual range... Seems like he's not the only one here.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: Is he working with someone?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: ...Seems to be someone from the plate.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: Woodrow, sir, is that... possible?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Anything's possible. When the government here collapsed, some young'uns with too much time on their hands formed gangs and started making trouble all over the place.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: But... what do they hope to accomplish by colluding with the bandits out in the barrens?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Jessica, they're about to disperse... Should we arrest them?
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: What do you think, Woodrow?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Wait and see. Now's not the time.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Then, umm... Don't do anything for now. Record where they showed up, and contact me if they show up here again.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Alright, no problem.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: One sec. Which direction did the bandits go? I'm gonna follow 'em and have a look.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: They went southeast.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: Should I come with you?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Nah, I can handle this myself.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Head back for now.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Er, Jessica... is that gentleman someone from the plate?
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: Umm, he's been investigating these bandits on his own, so he should be able to help us out.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I... I'm not sure how to break this to you, but I feel like you need a reminder. Getting cozy with the locals rarely works out well.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: Wh-Why's that?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Places like Davistown don't just go on like normal after getting reclaimed by the government. They've always got other plans on the docket, and when the time comes, the businesses, the infrastructure... even the residents will be replaced.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: Replaced? Then, what happens to the original residents? Where do they go?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I don't know how Blacksteel usually handles it, but with my last employer, we were only responsible for kicking them out. What happened afterwards was none of our business.
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: How could they not care?! That's totally illegal! How could they just drive out all the locals?!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: *sigh*... There's always an excuse when it comes to places like this on the verge of bankruptcy. Like, bad debts, tax investigations, security concerns...
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: Debts...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Not just me. Everyone left here is in debt. *sigh*... How do I put this? Well, I'll just give it to you straight.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: You asked about a guy who walked out into the snowfield earlier, right? It's probably 'cause of his debts... That kinda stuff happens all the time here. After being forced into bankruptcy, he had no choice but to...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Jessica? Hey, Jessica! What's gotten into you?
attributes.name: Blacksteel Mercenary

attributes.content: I... I'm heading back first.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: ...that stubborn, good-for-nothing father of yours... starting today...
attributes.name: Distant Voice

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: ...what nonsense are you spewing...
attributes.name: Distant Voice

attributes.content: ...let go of me...
attributes.name: Distant Voice

attributes.content: Is that a child's voice?!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: This brat sure knows how to whine. Guess he needs a gag and a good beating before he'll learn to follow us obedientlyâ€”
attributes.name: Vicious Gangster

attributes.content: Stop right there! Let go of him!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: And why should I? Who the hell are you?
attributes.name: Dopey Gangster

attributes.content: Help! They're trying to kidnap me!
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Don't make me repeat myselfâ€”let go of the kid!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: His father's in so much debt that even selling the boy off wouldn't pay it all back. So what if we kidnap him?
attributes.name: Dopey Gangster

attributes.content: Debt? Are you here to collect debts? Wait, don't tell me you're working for the bank?!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: ...Mind your own damn business. Now get outta here!
attributes.name: Vicious Gangster

attributes.content: Help! Someone, save meâ€”
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Shut your damn mouthâ€”
attributes.name: Vicious Gangster

attributes.content: Urgh... *cough*...
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Last warningâ€”let the kid go, and don't make any rash moves. Otherwise, my next bullet won't just be a warning shot!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: ...Tch, playing hardball, huh?
attributes.name: Vicious Gangster

attributes.content: Let's get out of here. No point risking our lives over this damn brat.
attributes.name: Vicious Gangster

attributes.content: *pant*... *pant*...
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: What's your name? Where do you live? I can take you back home.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I'm Benny... And you can just leave me at the diner. My dad's there every night, so I can wait for him there.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Is your dad... Leone Theremin?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: How'd you know?
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: I've met him. Oh right, those two people back there were talking about his debt... Were they debt collectors sent by the bank?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Umm... At first, it was just collection letters. Then they started sending people to our house to cause trouble, and my dad chased them out. And this time, the bank probably wanted to use me to force him to pay them back.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: But that's clearly a crime...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Who's gonna stop them? There's no police here.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: ...Can you show me your dad's bills? I might be able to help.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You... Are you serious? His bills are something awful...
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: I took a gander and... there ain't a whole lot more we can do for the ol' tower this time around.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: I already told you, that Laura girl did a great job tidying things up and fixing what could be fixed. But you just had to come out here yourself.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: Just wanted to see if there's anything Blacksteel missed, that we could handle.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: What, you think they're gonna pay off your loans if you work overtime?
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: ...I can dream, can't I?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: You're better off praying for goldbacks to fall from the sky.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: I told you, your only lifeline at this point is selling off all the shares you've got in the mine.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: I know you blew your life savings and took out loans to get those shares, butâ€”
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: Hell no.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Then lemme ask you, how much debt is that payment from Blacksteel even gonna clear? I reckon it's nowhere close to even paying off the interest.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: How about this, then? Help me with the plant maintenance. We'll be able to keep it running off the fuel that Blacksteel brought.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: I also happen to have a few days off. I'll pay you with the money Blacksteel gave me, and that'll buy you some time with the bank, at least.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: No Miles, you earned that money. Besides, how's that any different from just giving it away?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Not like this, not like that, sounds to me like you got an excuse to say no to everything. It ain't gonna matter when you're bankrupt and the bank's stealing the shirt off your back.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: ...There's gotta be a way.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Beer, electricity, security deposit... Everything looks fine, and it's within the range of what I can cover...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: What you can cover...? Are you gonna pay off Leone's debt?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: If possible, yes.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Dad's more afraid of owing favors than anything else. When my brother passed away, he couldn't even afford a funeral. And when people offered to lend him money, he said he didn't wanna be treated like a beggar.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: So he ended up following Uncle Woodrow around outside. Logging, hunting, fincatching... He worked so hard those two months that when he came back his fingers were deformed.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: And how much money did he make from all that?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: About two or three thousand?
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: ...He'll never pay back his debts like that.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Wait, what... He's still one of the mine's shareholders?!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Forget it. After the mine shut down, he's had to pay all kinds of fuel fees, vacancy fees, and land management fees just to keep his shares... and he borrows piles of money from the bank every year to do it.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Th-That's practically an open wound they're bleeding him dry with. Even if I came in to help him, there's no way he'd be able to pay it off...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: If he doesn't dump those shares, he's going to have nothing left.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Not happening. Dad loves that mine more than anything. He'd never dump those shares, even if we both got sent to the frontier for hard labor.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Benny, don't talk about your father like that.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: By the way, Jessica, what's gotten into you all of a sudden? Is something wrong? Leone's still a shareholder in the mine, so the bank's not likely to make him declare bankruptcy anytime soon.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I saw someone try to kidnap Benny today... To force Leone to pay off his debts.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Kidnapping?!
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: They can go after Leone all they want, but to try to kidnap a teenage boy... Have they no shame?!
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Benny, you're staying with me for now. When Leone finds out his kid's missing, I'll give him a piece of my mind and ask him what the hell he's doing as a father!
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: No... Don't tell him. I don't want him to worry.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: We've gone way past 'making him worry.' He needs to know damn well the consequences of what he's doing!
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I... I still need to go home.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Gah... How can such a stubborn asshole have a kid as sweet as you?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: In any case, if he's willing to sell his shares, then thatâ€”combined with some tax rebates and preferential policies he never noticedâ€”should be enough to cover the debt.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You sure?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I... I can practically guarantee it.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Alright. Sounds like he just needs a good reminder to stop messing around.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: It's finally over...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: So, why is the main switch for the entire building located just a hundred steps from the front entrance? Is this also some great prescience from the bank's founder?
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: ...That's ridiculous.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: ...It doesn't make a lick of sense.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: One step, two steps, three steps... There's a desk seven paces out, then make a left turn...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: ...Twenty-four, twenty-five, twenty-six... Oops, bumped into the lamp.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Fifty-seven, fifty-eight, fifty-nine...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: One hundred.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Excuse me.
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: ...Can I help you?
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Is the bank still open? I... I'd like to take out a loanâ€”
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: Sylvia? Get over here Sylvia, quick. I'd like to borrow some money from the bank. Can I count on you to get me a slightly better interest rate? Oh, I should never have been so mean to you...
attributes.name: Irritable Woman

attributes.content: What... What are you doing here?
attributes.name: Irritable Woman

attributes.content: Wait, you... What are you doing here?
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: I'm sorry, you two, but we're not open for business today.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Seeing the couple stare at each other in silence, Sylvia bows her head and steps away from the bank's gates.
The whole way back, the thick darkness that even the street lights do not penetrate lingers with her, caressing her neck affectionately.
Since her mother passed away, she's left work the same way every day, just like this.
...One thousand eight hundred seventy-seven, one thousand eight hundred seventy-eight. And, home.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Mom, I'm home.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: She waits for a long time, but only silence greets her back.
After a moment, she takes out her keys, opens the door, wipes the soles of her shoes on the doormat, and leaves the suffocating darkness in the street behind her.
